channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Fight MND and 2023 Big Freeze
item.description:
Sunday, June 11, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support Fight MND and 2023 Big Freeze.

This campaign aims to shine a light on the battle being fought by thousands of people across Australia who are diagnosed with MND. Currently there are no viable treatments and no cure for MND, and with continued research we aim to eventually make MND a thing of the past.

This Light Up is organised by: Cure for MND Foundation

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:

This Light Up is organised by: Cure for MND Foundation
item.x-trumba:customfield: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Philippine Independence Day
item.description:
Monday, June 12, 2023

Sandgate Town Hall will be lit Red, White and Blue to support Philippine Independence Day.

To ensure an audience of at least 100,000+ worldwide (through social media) will focus on Brisbane as the City and its Filipino-Australians residents join together to recognise the Philippines 125th Independence Day. Last year's Light Up for the 124th Philippines Independence Day (on its 3rd year) attracted 18,000+ views in the Chamber's FB page. This year's 125th anniversary will have a much larger audience as the anniversary dinner is planned to be held at one of the function areas at the Sandgate Town Hall.

This Light Up is organised by: Chamber of Commerce and Industry Australia Philippines Inc

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate
item.xCal:description:
Sandgate Town Hall will be lit Red, White and Blue to support Philippine Independence Day.
To ensure an audience of at least 100,000+ worldwide (through social media) will focus on Brisbane as the City and its Filipino-Australians residents join together to recognise the Philippines 125th Independence Day. Last year's Light Up for the 124th Philippines Independence Day (on its 3rd year) attracted 18,000+ views in the Chamber's FB page. This year's 125th anniversary will have a much larger audience as the anniversary dinner is planned to be held at one of the function areas at the Sandgate Town Hall.
This Light Up is organised by: Chamber of Commerce and Industry Australia Philippines Inc
item.x-trumba:customfield: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate

item.title: Philippine Independence Day
item.description:
Monday, June 12, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red, White and Blue to recognise Philippine Independence Day.

The Philippine Declaration of Independence was proclamied on June 12th 1898. Today the Chamber of Commerce and Industry Australia Philippines Incorporated would like to focus on Brisbane as the City and its Filipino-Australians residents, joining together to recognise the Philippines 125th Independence Day.

This Light Up is organised by: Chamber of Commerce and Industry Australia Philippines Inc

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:

item.title: National Blood Donor Week
item.description:
Tuesday, June 13, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red to support National Blood Donor Week.

Australian Red Cross Lifeblood is committed to providing life-giving essence to support the everyday wellbeing of all Australians — through blood, plasma, transplantation and biological products. National Blood Donor Week celebrates the Lifeblood donor community and acknowledges the amazing efforts of our donors and the people who receive blood products. The week also gives Lifeblood an opportunity to inspire others to become donors.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian Red Cross Lifeblood

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red to support National Blood Donor Week.
Australian Red Cross Lifeblood is committed to providing life-giving essence to support the everyday wellbeing of all Australians — through blood, plasma, transplantation and biological products. National Blood Donor Week celebrates the Lifeblood donor community and acknowledges the amazing efforts of our donors and the people who receive blood products. The week also gives Lifeblood an opportunity to inspire others to become donors.
This Light Up is organised by: Australian Red Cross Lifeblood

item.title: 2023 Migraine Awareness Month
item.description:
Wednesday, June 14, 2023

City Hall will be lit Purple to support 2023 Migraine Awareness Month.

Migraine Australia runs Migraine Awareness Month in June to raise awareness of migraine and advocate for better services and support for people living with migraine.

This Light Up is organised by: Migraine Australia Ltd

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
City Hall will be lit Purple to support 2023 Migraine Awareness Month.
Migraine Australia runs Migraine Awareness Month in June to raise awareness of migraine and advocate for better services and support for people living with migraine.
This Light Up is organised by: Migraine Australia Ltd

item.title: Red Frogs Gala Dinner
item.description:
Thursday, June 15, 2023

City Hall will be lit Red to support Red Frogs Gala Dinner.

Red Frogs exists to safeguard the next generation. We are a support network activated in Festivals, Universities, Schoolies, Sporting venues, Schools and Skate parks. The Gala Dinner raises awareness and finances for the work of Red Frogs throughout the year.

This Light Up is organised by: Red Frogs Australia

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
City Hall will be lit Red to support Red Frogs Gala Dinner.
Red Frogs exists to safeguard the next generation. We are a support network activated in Festivals, Universities, Schoolies, Sporting venues, Schools and Skate parks. The Gala Dinner raises awareness and finances for the work of Red Frogs throughout the year.
This Light Up is organised by: Red Frogs Australia
item.x-trumba:customfield: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: World Elder Abuse Awareness Day
item.description:
Thursday, June 15, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Purple to support World Elder Abuse Awareness Day.

WEAAD- World Elder Abuse Awareness Day, aims to raise awareness surrounding elder abuse, recognise the signs of elder abuse and identify the supports available to people experiencing elder abuse.

This Light Up is organised by: Caxton Legal Centre Inc

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
item.xCal:location: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
item.xCal:description:
The Tropical Dome will be lit Purple to support World Elder Abuse Awareness Day.
WEAAD- World Elder Abuse Awareness Day, aims to raise awareness surrounding elder abuse, recognise the signs of elder abuse and identify the supports available to people experiencing elder abuse.
This Light Up is organised by: Caxton Legal Centre Inc
item.x-trumba:customfield: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Hero for Heartkids
item.description:
Friday, June 16, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Red and Blue to support Hero for Heartkids.

HeartKids is the only national not-for-profit organisation solely focused on supporting and advocating for all people impacted by childhood heart disease, one of the largest causes of infant death in Australia.Hero for HeartKids is our annual awareness and fundraising campaign that motivates people to be heroes for heart kids!

This Light Up is organised by: Heartkids Limited

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
item.xCal:description:
The Story Bridge will be lit Red and Blue to support Hero for Heartkids.
HeartKids is the only national not-for-profit organisation solely focused on supporting and advocating for all people impacted by childhood heart disease, one of the largest causes of infant death in Australia.Hero for HeartKids is our annual awareness and fundraising campaign that motivates people to be heroes for heart kids!
This Light Up is organised by: Heartkids Limited
item.x-trumba:customfield: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: 2023 Queens Ball Awards
item.description:
Saturday, June 17, 2023

City Hall will be lit Red, Purple, Orange, Blue, Yellow and Green to support 2023 Queens Ball Awards.

The 2023 Queens Ball Awards being held at City Hall celebrates 62 years of celebrating and recognising LGBTIQ+ people achievements. This event serves as a major fundraiser for Brisbane Pride Festival.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Pride Festival

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
City Hall will be lit Red, Purple, Orange, Blue, Yellow and Green to support 2023 Queens Ball Awards.
The 2023 Queens Ball Awards being held at City Hall celebrates 62 years of celebrating and recognising LGBTIQ+ people achievements. This event serves as a major fundraiser for Brisbane Pride Festival.
This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Pride Festival
item.x-trumba:customfield: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: You Are Not Alone Fun Run
item.description:
Saturday, June 17, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Yellow to support You Are Not Alone Fun Run.

The You Are Not Alone Fun Run and Festival raises awareness around youth mental health and suicide. The event aims to be a conversation starter amongst family and friends.

This Light Up is organised by: You Are Not Alone and Lifeline

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Eve of Heart Failure Awareness Week
item.description:
Sunday, June 18, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Red to support Eve of Heart Failure Awareness Week.

hearts4heart, have joined forces to launch the first Australian Heart Failure Patient Journey Guide on the 21st June 2023. The launch will coincide with Australia’s second annual Heart Failure Awareness Week (June 19 – 25). The national campaign aims to raise awareness about the prevalence of heart failure, increase understanding of heart failure symptoms, and highlight the importance of early detection to improve patient outcomes. To find out more visit hearts4heart.org.au.

This Light Up is organised by: hearts4heart

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: World Sickle Cell Day
item.description:
Monday, June 19, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Red to support World Sickle Cell Day.

World Sickle Cell Day is on the 19th June, 2023 and is an internationally recognised awareness day promoting equitable access to treatment of those living with sickle cell disease and to break down stigma in the community.

This Light Up is organised by: Thalaessmia and Sickle Cell Australia

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Bowel Cancer Awareness Month and Eve of Red Apple Day
item.description:
Tuesday, June 20, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Red and Green to support Bowel Cancer Awareness Month and Eve of Red Apple Day.

Bowel Cancer Awareness Month - Bowel Cancer Australia's signature event to raise awareness of Australia's second deadliest cancer and Red Apple Day is our Annual Giving Day, when Australians are encouraged to support the vital work of the charity.

This Light Up is organised by: Bowel Cancer Australia

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: State of Origin Game II
item.description:
Wednesday, June 21, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Maroon to celebrate State of Origin Game II.

After a courageous win in Game I by the Maroons. Will Queensland seal the series at the Cauldron tonight or will the Blues be able to send it to a decider at Accor Stadium on July 12.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.description:
Thursday, June 22, 2023

City Hall will be lit White and Green to celebrate the 2023 Queensland Architecture Awards.

This event is being held in City Hall.

This light up is organised by: The Royal Australian Institute of Architects Limited



Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City

item.title: CEO Sleepout
item.description:
Thursday, June 22, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support CEO Sleepout.

Vinnie's CEO Sleep out happens on 22 June 2023, where leaders in business, community and government will sleep without shelter onone of the longest nights of the year to help change the lives of Australians experiencing homelessness.

This Light Up is organised by: St Vincent de Paul

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: MND Awareness Week and Cornflower Blue Day
item.description:
Friday, June 23, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Mid Blue to support MND Awareness Week and Cornflower Blue Day.

MND Queensland aims to increase awareness of the impact of Motor Neurone Disease so that we can provide better care and support to Queenslanders currently living with the disease, as well as support their loved ones during and after this difficult time. The blue cornflower (Centaurea cyanus) is the symbol of hope for MND around the world because of its fragile appearance but hardy nature. Like the cornflower, people living with MND show remarkable strength in coping with this devastating disease.

This Light Up is organised by: MND Queensland

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Olympic Day
item.description:
Friday, June 23, 2023

Sandgate Town Hall will be lit Green and Gold to support Olympic Day.

Olympic Day is celebrated all around the world on 23 June, in global celebration of the founding of the International Olympic Committee and the modern Olympic Movement in 1894.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate

item.title: St John's Day and 140 Years of St John's Queensland
item.description:
Saturday, June 24, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red to support St John's Day and 140 Years of St John's Queensland.

On Saturday 24 June, St John Ambulance celebrates 140 years of saving lives. St John Ambulance Qld, in conjunction with its national and international counterparts, will celebrate with a campaign designed to raise awareness of the importance of first aid, and funding for our growing portfolio of community support programs.

This Light Up is organised by: St John's Ambulance Queensland

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: International Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month
item.description:
Sunday, June 25, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Teal to support International Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month.

Myasthenia Gravis is a neurological auto-immune condition and affects the transmission of messages between nerves and the muscle fibre. www.mgaq.org.au .  International Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month spreads awareness  of Myasthenia Gravis, the impact it has on people and the message of  "Patient Voices Matter".

This Light Up is organised by: Myasthenia Gravis Association of Queensland Inc (MGAQ)

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: 2023 PTSD Awareness Day
item.description:
Tuesday, June 27, 2023

Sandgate Town Hall will be lit Blue to support 2023 PTSD Awareness Day.

PTSD Awareness Day falls on June 27 each year. It raises critical awareness and understanding of the hidden impacts of PTSD and helps more people to know about the condition. In turn, this means that more sufferers will have access to effective treatments they need to recover and renew their lives.

This Light Up is organised by: Phoenix Australia

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate

This Light Up is organised by: Phoenix Australia

item.title: World Scleroderma and Shine like a Sunflower Day
item.description:
Thursday, June 29, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Yellow to support World Scleroderma and Shine like a Sunflower Day.

This June is World Scleroderma Month and Scleroderma Australia is bringing a golden glow to more than 110 iconic locations across Australia to help us raise scleroderma awareness by sharing the Shine Like a Sunflower campaign.

This Light Up is organised by: Scleroderma Australia

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
